misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to remove or update inactive tasks
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: ecs task definition set to inactive status

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to increase the performance of their ecs service(s)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: if max memory utilization is > 50% for more than 3 concecutive time periods AND autoscaling is not enabled
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable autoscalling policy with target tracking; set target to 50%

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to make sure their services are all running the latest platform version
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: update service in console to LATEST
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: this will cause the service to automatically rollback to the last stable state

misconfigurations.scenario:
- user wants to increase the reliability of their ecs sevices / tasks and/or
- user has been experiencing frequent service failures and/or
- users' ecs services have been failing health checks
misconfigurations.alert_criteria:
- fargate launch type and/or
- tasks have transitioned to a failed state > 3 times in the last 21 day and/or 
- are failing healthchecks
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: this will cause the service to automatically rollback to the last stable state

misconfigurations.scenario: ECS task definitions are configured with unsafe defaults including public IPs, privileged mode, or plaintext secrets
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: ECS tasks assigned public IP addresses when not required, containers running in privileged mode, or secrets passed as plaintext environment variables
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Configure ECS tasks without public IPs in private subnets, disable privileged mode, use Secrets Manager for credentials, and enable read-only root filesystems
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: ECS task misconfigurations create significant security risks. Public IP assignments expose containers directly to the internet. Privileged mode grants containers host-level access. Plaintext secrets in environment variables can be extracted by anyone with task describe permissions. Security Hub includes checks for these misconfigurations and AWS recommends using private subnets with NAT gateways, non-privileged containers, and Secrets Manager integration.
misconfigurations.notes: Security Hub provides automated checks for ECS task definition misconfigurations

metadata.source: AWS Security Best Practices 2025 / Community Contribution
